author: dylan
content:
Voice note from morning walk:

Thinking about how we've been building in public for 6 months now... the transparency has been scary but also freeing. People actually respond to the messy parts more than the polished announcements.

That time I shared our failed product launch got 10x the engagement of any success post.

Maybe there's something here about vulnerability in leadership? Or authenticity vs. performance?

Also random idea - what if we did a behind the scenes series showing actual slack conversations?
